Posted: October 12, 2016
												Although I am not much of a game critic, I must say this game is ♥♥♥♥ing phenomenal. The unit selection is very wide, with many different tanks, and support vehicles for every faction. As well as different variations of infantry, ranging from cheap rifle squads to elite infantry teams. The artillery in this game works ♥♥♥♥ing amazingly. Every time one of my howitzer rounds lands on a large group of infantry I feel a rush of satisfaction. If you are a fan of large scale rts games, especially realistic ones, and if you like micro management this is a game for you. I personally have an obsession with WW2 and have always wanted a game where I could command large groups of soldiers and tanks on the battlefield. And I have finally found it.I recommend this to any stratedgy lover with every fiber of my being. Just a little tip to anyone newer to the game, if you are having trouble figuring out how to play this game effectively, I recommend either reading up on the different unit stats, or just looking up some basic military stratedgies because this game is very reliant on historical accuracy of the different weapons and vehicles used in WW2. Every unit in this game has specific uses so if you don't understand how to use each of them proplerly you aren't going to last long whether it be against the AI in skirmish mode or real players in MP. Speaking of multiplayer, be sure to download gameranger or a similar client available, as GameSpy(the original multiplayer server host) is no longer in use.I hope this was helpful :D

												This game is breathtaking. It's a visual stunner; you notice every detail as you are creeping through a forest with an M18 Hellcat and using the trees as camoflage. Posted: March 4, 2016
												This game is the most challenging, fun, realistic and makes me rage the most. Men of War: Assault Squad allows you to play as UK, USA, Germany, Russia and Japan throughout three missions for each country (you can add more missions via DLC.) Each counry has their strong points such as Germans rule with tanks, USA's availability for air strikes and dropping airbourne and Japan's light tank rush. In terms of realism, the tanks actually use tank physics so your crew can get damaged, indivdual tank parts can be damaged and become unable to use (unable to move around or shoot etc.) until the tank is repaired by any infantry unit. Speaking of infantry, you get a medic as apart of your army and he is essential if you want to win a lot easier. Your units actually carry ammunition so you have to be careful on how many shots they fire and or waste, otherwise you'll need to capture an enemy checkpoint for a small amount of ammo or bring in an ammo truck for your units. This game is fun because there are different strategies for you to use during the mission and you have to really consider the strengths and weaknesses of each unit alot during the mission. One wrong move and your unit can get destroyed or killed. The game uses MP which you gather slowly to call in units such as infantry, anti-vehicle artillery, HM guns, mortars, tanks and special abilities like parashooting down airbourne and getting a little remote-detonated tank.What makes me rage at this game so much is the amount of anti-vehicle placements that the enemy starts off with. If you try to bring ANY unit up they'll get demolished and since your tanks have mediocre accuracy, even if they shoot first they still get destroyed. Another thing is that the enemy keeps bringing in tanks and troops and if you leave a captured checkpoint unguarded, they'll recapture it and you'll lose the unit you can buy when you captured it (like a heavy tank or medium-tank.) Another thing is that your units sometimes won't fire at the enemy despite being in range and have some ammo to spare. It reallys gets annoying and you have to move them closer and the next moment your unit is killed by anti-vehicle. For missions, you are given the same objective no matter what country you play as. You have to clear three lines of defences (3 centre checkpoints and 6 optional ones) and finally capture the last checpoint which is near the end of the map. It is repeatitive and it gets boring for long peroids of time  that each mission will take you about an hour to do so it's better for one mission at a time and and have a break.If you're a multiplayer type, don't get this game because the online provider, GameSpy, shut down it's servers some time ago and you can only play on a LAN connection. While the online mod has no AI to face apart from campaign missions, you can still play co-op with a LAN buddy and do the misisions which are called "Skirimish" for no reason when it isn't and three other game modes against each other. In all this game is challenging, even for the easiest difficult and if you're fan of realism, you'll love this game. If you're not the strategic type and just prefer to crush your enemy with tanks and brute strength, I recommend you don't get this game because it really needs planning and for you to react to disadvantages accordinly to counter-attack the opposition. For this game I rate a 8/10.

Posted: June 28, 2015
												TL;DR: This game shines for it's editor and Multiplayer. Don't get hyped over the campaign.Forget the Singleplayer skirmish/campaigns(unless you want to get campaign mods/missions). The Editor is where it shines. You don't even need to know how to script to use the editor(I ended up learning alot of scripting and stuff because I like flushed out missions). Being able to create a huge offensive is insanely fun. And, it is VERY easy to make the maps you develop/edit available in Multiplayer. If you come here for the Singleplayer campaign, you might be dissapointed. The missions are repetitive(they're all the same). Each mission is a map with about 3 rows of 3 objectives. Each nation also has one "stealth" mission, you still have to take the objective, and one defense mission. It is fun at first, but it gets to the point where it is too repetitive. Also. Check out a mod named Dynamic Campaign Editor. It really freshes the game up a bit, or a lot I should say. I have over 45~ hours in that mod alone. Great mod.

Posted: March 13, 2015
												This game requires so much attention to be played correctly. In many RPG-styled games you would control one character and manage his/her items in an inventory -- In Men of War, every unit you control has an inventory. So, that means you should make sure each unit is equipped with the right gear before assigning orders. Helmets can fly off your soldiers' heads and be picked up again, their weapons can be dropped after being stunned by a grenade going off near them.. So many things can happen. You, as the commander, need to not only focus on the battlefield but MUST pay close attention to each unit. People often compare Company of Heroes with this game, I think that's quite stupid. They are completely different games. Company of Heroes offers tactical combat as well but it is more fast paced and you need not think so much about the units individually (no inventory etc).. There are many more mechanics in Men of War that Company of Heroes could've used to achieve realism, but we are talking about games here so realism shouldn't be the main concern.If you like games set in the World War 2 era, this is a must play. --- It's most enjoyable with a friend, as stated in other reviews the AI are very difficult. You can work through the co-op with your friends and still get the achievements for the missions.Matches are usually quite lengthy, so don't expect to rush your opponent.The only problem I have with this game is the voice acting. It is the worst I have ever heard in my life and the dialogue is really pathetic. Since when do American people shout "FOR THE MOTHERLAND!"!??! .. It really ruins the experience for me. Easily fixed though, turn off voice volume and play with your own music. I play to the OST from Fury and other movies. Or better yet, change the language of the game.. Because I play in Russian the voices sound much more authentic than they did before hand. (Warning: Changing language means everything will change xD not just the voices, but the interface... Everything)Last but not least, this game has a lot of "replayability" due to all the mods available for it.Overall, I rate this game: 8.5/10

Posted: April 18, 2016
												This is a great a great RTS game, where you can take direct control of soldiers, mounted weapons, tanks, vehicles, etc.(not planes though.) Each Scenario(5 countries to play, about 5-8 scenarios each) has you start with one or two squads of units, usually infantry, and you go out and accomplish the objectives. As you do, you earn MP(Military Points I think) which you can use to call in more squads of units(Infantry, Flamethrower, Anti-Tank, Tank, Artillery, etc.).Each unit also has their own inventory, and you can take the weapons, ammo, grenades, hats, medkits, etc. from fallen enemies, cars, and you can even call in a Supply Truck with more stuff with MP. You don't have to micro-manage though, because if someone needs ammo but doesn't have, and someone near them does, they'll automatically pass some to them.This game has a lot of strategy, and units take realistic damage, so Infantry will go down in 4-6 shots, and tanks can annihilate squads in seconds. Pretty much anything can be used as cover.I definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys RTS games, Strategy games, or the Company of Heroes series.

Posted: March 16, 2013
												MOW:AS (pronounced MO' A$$) is a fun and action-packed RTS game. You are able to command forces from Japan, Germany, England, the USA, and Soviet Russia through the campaign or against other players. Movement and deployment of units is intuitive and can be done from the perspective of the general or the unit itself. The one thing that's frustrating is when the enemy who you are attacking has artillery and especially anti-tank guns, when this situation arises it is almost impossible to resolve unless you are playing as Englend in which case you have the power to take those guns out with your own heavy artillery. Russia also has heavy artillery, but it is not as good.

												Great game with some sandbox features that you can use with the editor that it has.Furthermore the in-depth action and the reality of the hardcore warfare with it's physics and graphics that really stand-out in game.The dialouge from the charcters creates more immersion while playing and the explosions (evry1 loves explosions) are fantastic.Nonetheless to be able to pick your own country go through it's campaign then save the mission go to another and besides that theres not actual real objective while playing except you have to capture command posts.The modding community is awesome too.With various ranges between futuristic stuff all the way to ww1.I'd reccomend this game to a person who would take alot of time with it and mod it.Otherwise this game is just amazing and it will always be because of the communitys.

Posted: June 2, 2011
												A mortar is an indirect fire weapon that fires shells at low velocities, short ranges, and high-arcing ballistic trajectories. It is typically muzzle-loading and has a barrel length less than 15 times its caliber. A mortar is relatively simple and easy to operate. A modern mortar consists of a tube into which gunners drop a shell, which is usually referred to as a bomb. The shell contains a quantity of propellant. When it reaches the base of the tube it hits a firing pin, which detonates the propellant and fires the shell. Some larger caliber mortars have a string operated firing pin instead of a fixed one. The tube is generally set at between 45 and 85 degrees angle to the ground, with the higher angle giving shorter firing distances.

												great game, truly. thumbs up, and all, but zomg the horrendous voice "acting". all countries have the same guy, apparently, which ever-so-slightly breaks the immersion. its as if they spent their entire budget on the gameplay, but ran out just before they got the voices in.for example, if youre playing as Germany, you dont get that fervent guy with the broken english, saying stuff like "zey are breaking through, mein fuhrer!". nononono, instead you get some nerdy american white guy who might as well be saying "golly gee, mister, there are a lot of guys coming!"or play as Japan, and hear the most rediculous, again, nerdy white american accent tell you "Emperor, we must drive them back!"awesome game, and totally worth buying, if you like rts's. just sayin, for $5 they could have hired a bum to come in and do the voices, with better results.
